guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

guild.name: Christianity

meta_description: Israeli archaeologists on Tuesday announced the discovery of dozens of Dead Sea Scroll fragments bearing a biblical text found in a desert cave and believed hidden during a Jewish revolt against Rome nearly 1,900 years ago.
meta_title: Israeli experts announce discovery of more Dead Sea scrolls
title: Israeli experts announce discovery of more Dead Sea scrolls

body:
What a weird coincidence it will be when the Israeli authorities announce that these Dead Sea Scrolls contain oddly specific passages from Jesus himself concerning who are the rightful heirs of Israel.

Weirder still that Jesus was so specific about the King James Version of the Bible being heresy. Good thing I have my Scofield Bible!
body_html:
What a weird coincidence it will be when the Israeli authorities announce that these Dead Sea Scrolls contain oddly specific passages from Jesus himself concerning who are the rightful heirs of Israel.

Weirder still that Jesus was so specific about the King James Version of the Bible being heresy. Good thing I have my Scofield Bible!

body: The masoretic is still more accurate outside of those few corruptions. And the Greek text has corruptions of its own. It's not that significant though, the worst was in the time of Josiah and then again during/after the Babylonian exile in the 4th century BC.
body_html: The masoretic is still more accurate outside of those few corruptions. And the Greek text has corruptions of its own. It's not that significant though, the worst was in the time of Josiah and then again during/after the Babylonian exile in the 4th century BC.

body:
Ah. I should have read that second paragraph more carefully instead of skimming see. I just saw "King James Version" and figured Evangelical KJV onlyist. And I've literally heard several Evangelicals claiming the DSS "confirms the KJV". 

Also, I don't think there are too many Christian Zionists using the Scofield nowadays. Many use the KJV however.
body_html:

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

I'm mostly here to learn (hard times have had me turning to Christ, as I'm sure has happened a billion times before throughout history), and occasionally shitpost about the jooooos.

body: The Scofield is KJV. Just as long as you use the old standard and not the "new" Scofield where they actually started to remove words from the bible. I'll hold fast to my KJV and know its the perfect word of God.

parent.body:
Ah. I should have read that second paragraph more carefully instead of skimming see. I just saw "King James Version" and figured Evangelical KJV onlyist. And I've literally heard several Evangelicals claiming the DSS "confirms the KJV". 

Also, I don't think there are too many Christian Zionists using the Scofield nowadays. Many use the KJV however.

body: There are hundreds of english translations, what makes the KJV so special? As someone who studies the original texts the KJV is no more accurate than any other english bible, in fact it's even worse in some places and certain renderings are abhorrent.
body_html: There are hundreds of english translations, what makes the KJV so special? As someone who studies the original texts the KJV is no more accurate than any other english bible, in fact it's even worse in some places and certain renderings are abhorrent.

body:
Scofield is an annotated study Bible. And I doubt most Evangelical Zionist read it nowadays. 

And Christo-pagans that claim that the KJV is perfect, inspired or inerrent are probably the most retarded clowns to ever walk this planet, and you don't speak a word of Greek or Hebrew anyway. 

But no, polytheist, no Christians canon as compiled and canonized claim itself to be God's word. And no, polytheist, your KJV that has already been heavily revised -- which is why you in all likelihood is using the 1769 Cambridge edition -- still contains countless errors, and if any of you lying, satanic polytheists ever read the translator's original preface, you'd know they knew for a fact they weren't producing anything perfect of inspired. 

And what's even more hilariously ironic when it comes to the unparalleled retardation of KJV onlyists; the KJV is an Anglican translatation, polytheist. As in Catholicism lite with the English monarch in place of the pope. And it was largely translated to clarify the ecclesiastical structure and authority of the Anglican Church KJV only clowns don't even belong to. You just have to appreciate the layers of irony and absolute idiocy of the blasphemous, lying, satanic, pagan polytheists.
body_html:
Scofield is an annotated study Bible. And I doubt most Evangelical Zionist read it nowadays.

And Christo-pagans that claim that the KJV is perfect, inspired or inerrent are probably the most retarded clowns to ever walk this planet, and you don't speak a word of Greek or Hebrew anyway.

But no, polytheist, no Christians canon as compiled and canonized claim itself to be God's word. And no, polytheist, your KJV that has already been heavily revised -- which is why you in all likelihood is using the 1769 Cambridge edition -- still contains countless errors, and if any of you lying, satanic polytheists ever read the translator's original preface, you'd know they knew for a fact they weren't producing anything perfect of inspired.

And what's even more hilariously ironic when it comes to the unparalleled retardation of KJV onlyists; the KJV is an Anglican translatation, polytheist. As in Catholicism lite with the English monarch in place of the pope. And it was largely translated to clarify the ecclesiastical structure and authority of the Anglican Church KJV only clowns don't even belong to. You just have to appreciate the layers of irony and absolute idiocy of the blasphemous, lying, satanic, pagan polytheists.
